oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mural of Norris Dam
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Design diagram of Norris Dam. Caption reads: " Norris Dam 1933-1936; Height 265 Feet - Length 860 Feet; Concrete - 1,002,253 Cubic Yards; Storage - 830 Billion Gallons; Reservoir Area - 40,160 Acres; Power - Two 50,000 KW Generating Units; Length of Lake - Clinch River 72 Miles - Powell River 56 Miles."

Norris Dam was the first dam constructed by the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA). It was begun in 1933 and was finished in 1936. Thousands of families were relocated in order to make the dam and reservoir, which generated a great deal of animosity.
